page.title: 02 LANDSCAPE & FARMING
page.content: The land in this area ,like the rest of Norfolk,is fairly flat,but this area is not fenland,the highest point being 250m.Litcham itself is approximatley 150-200m above sea level.In the given area there are 3 villages with Litcham being the largest.Beeston and Bittering are small isolated villages. A large percentage of the land is arable;the soil being good loam soil although glacial clay is common too.The main crops are cereals(wheat,barley)and sugar beet.There is little woodland or common land,the largest area being east of Litcham. Litcham is a nodal point with the B1145 running east-west though it and 7 smaller roads leading to and from it in a north-south direction.The river Nar runs though this area.
